snippet: Peter Gelb, the Metropolitan Opera’s general manager, discussed ideas to raise money and increase its audiences, including Sunday performances and expanding the opera house’s lobby.
abstract: Metropolitan Opera's general manager Peter Gelb is considering additional means of raising revenue as he enters his 10th season at helm; past efforts have borne fruit, but falling box-office revenues have raised concerns; new ideas include staging performances on Sundays, expanding lobby and appending famous donor name to opera house.
lead_paragraph: Peter Gelb, the Metropolitan Opera’s general manager, discussed ideas to raise money and increase its audiences, including Sunday performances and expanding the opera house’s lobby.

headline.main: The Met Considers Naming Rights, and Other Ways Forward
headline.print_headline: The Met Mulls Naming Rights as It Looks Forward
